file-read.description: Each input line is treated as a filename for the 'file' command and the output is corrupted by a suffix ':' followed by the result or the error of the operation, so this may not be suitable for binary files.

Each line is corrupted by a prefix string and wrapped inside quotes, so this may not be suitable for binary files. If a line in the target file begins with a '#', it will not be printed as these lines are parsed as comments. It can also be provided with a directory and will read each file in the directory.

suid.description: Each input line is treated as a filename for the 'file' command and the output is corrupted by a suffix ':' followed by the result or the error of the operation, so this may not be suitable for binary files.
